<a href="https://athleticgreens.go2cloud.org/aff_c?offer_id=27&aff_id=1033&adv_unique1=partner&aff_sub=morningbrew&aff_sub2=publisher&aff_sub5=newsletter&aff_sub3=morningbrew_d3k2_102720&aff_sub4=cac&adv_unique3=business" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Athletic Greens" style="width:100%;max-width: 141px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="141" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8xOTMvMTU4NTQ4Njg0NS1Db3B5X29mX0FHX0hvcml6b250YWxfTG9nb19CbHVlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0="></a>
</th>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Our biggest learning from yesterday’s newsletter replies: Apparently the city is called just Tampa—not Tampa Bay. Still, why do all the sports teams use Tampa Bay? It’s not the Boston Harbor Red Sox. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All of this to say, don’t let our mistake get in your head, Rays. We picked you to win the World Series back in July and need you to pull through in Game 6 tonight.</p>
</td>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/26/tough-q3-covid-outlook-wipe-35b-sap-market-value?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You Poor SAP
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A photograph of SAP's headquarters in Walldorf, Germany" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTE1L3NhcC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>SAP</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Think you had an unproductive Monday? At least you didn't lose $35 billion (we hope). That's how much SAP's <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/26/sap-market-cap-plunges-by-30-billion.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">market value fell</a> yesterday, following dismal Q3 earnings that tanked shares 23%.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">SAP who? </strong></span><span>Europe's biggest tech company by sales, SAP is a German software vendor that rose to prominence in the '70s and '80s selling enterprise resource planning software (which organizes business processes like HR, customer relationship management, and accounting into a shared database). </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Against the backdrop of <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/25/third-wave-covid19-threatens-us-businesses?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rising Covid-19 infections</a>, SAP cutting profit targets and hunkering down for a couple more quarters could be a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-26/sap-s-disappointing-results-are-warning-for-u-s-tech-earnings?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worrying sign</a> for other tech companies. Shares of SAP's competitors Salesforce and Oracle fell 3.4% and 4%, respectively.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">SAP was already dealing with some clouds</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the last decade, SAP has moved to join its legacy tech peers IBM and Microsoft aboard the cloud computing bandwagon. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Back in the old days when you looked up your crush's number in the white pages, companies stored their data on computer servers in the office basement. With the rise of cloud computing, they can now buy that software over the internet and outsource the hardware to cloud infrastructure providers like Amazon, Google, and Microsoft. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The cloud is <a href="https://www.zdnet.com/article/sap-charts-new-course-to-accelerate-cloud-shift-co-innovation-one-data-model/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cannibalizing</a> the software licensing model SAP used to make its big bucks from. So SAP is pushing customers to cloud-based software subscriptions, which bring in less money upfront but offer a more predictable, recurring revenue stream. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That transition takes time, even without a pandemic. While Covid-19 has accelerated cloud adoption, it's also created more uncertainty for businesses—forcing some to <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/10/26/sap-shares-fall-sharply-after-covid-19-cuts-revenue-profit-forecast-at-software-giant/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit pause</a> on big IT investments. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The latest wave of Covid infections means SAP is expecting to feel those impacts through the first half of 2021.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Tech stocks have buoyed the market recovery, but SAP's plunge could undermine investor confidence in other software vendors facing similar headwinds.</p>

</h3>

<font color="#000000">
Ant Group, Yesterday

</h1>

<small><em>Giphy</em></small>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ant Group, the Chinese fintech giant, is set to raise at least $34.4 billion in its IPO, according to new pricing terms released yesterday. That would make it the <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ant-group-ipo/investors-line-up-for-ant-groups-record-34-4-billion-ipo-idUSKBN27B1CB?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">largest public offering</a> in history.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Valued at around $313 billion, Ant will go public in Hong Kong and Shanghai in the coming weeks...and could raise even more if underwriters decide to buy up to 15% more shares. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Our question: </strong>If Ant is now going to be the biggest IPO...who is it beating out? Saudi Aramco (raising $29.4 billion) is currently at the top, and here's the rest of the leaderboard. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">  <img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTEzL2JpZ2dlc3RfaXBvX2NoYXJ0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">ICBC = Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, and the company above that is the Agricultural Bank of China. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/26/facebook-tests-cloud-gaming-waters?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We’ve Come a Long Way Since Farmville
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook announced yesterday it’s rolling out a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/26/21528438/facebook-cloud-gaming-beta-android-web-jason-rubin-interview?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cloud gaming service</a>, in case you wanted to do something on the platform other than check whether it's any of your friends' birthdays. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s not the first to have the idea</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Google, Amazon, and Microsoft have all rolled out <a href="https://www.engadget.com/facebook-cloud-gaming-launch-web-android-asphalt-9-legends-120007686.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">their own</a> cloud gaming platforms with eye-popping tech specs and exclusive titles to attract paying customers. But Facebook is taking a fundamentally different approach than its rivals, focusing on free games, like the <em>Farmville</em> of yesteryear, that you can play within the Facebook app at your leisure.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>This is supposed to be a casual and accessible gaming experience: “No special hardware or controllers needed; your hands are the controller,” Jason Rubin, Facebook’s VP of Play, </span><span><a href="https://www.facebook.com/fbgaminghome/blog/cloud-gaming-meet-facebook-gaming?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a></span><span> in a blog post. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But one rotten Apple is cramping Rubin’s style. For now, FB’s games will only be available on Android and the web (not on iOS) because Facebook’s offering doesn’t jibe with Apple’s guidelines around streamable content.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> While rolling out a completely free-to-use service might not make business sense on the surface, Facebook makes money by keeping users on Facebook. Easy-to-pick-up, instantly available games streamed from the cloud might do just that. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And don’t get scared off by the word “athletic”; this power powder helps anyone looking to own their health by providing quality nutrients that <strong style="color:#000">support your gut health, immune system, stress levels,</strong> and <strong style="color:#000">increased energy. </strong></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ELECTION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/26/uber-lyft-spending-big-prop-22?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Uber and Lyft Are Feeling Prop 22
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Uber car in a garage" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDY4L3ViZXJfY2FyX2luX2FfZ2FyYWdlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>This article is part of our weeklong series exploring state-level issues in the upcoming election. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's Prop 22?</strong> It's an effort to beat back Assembly Bill 5, a controversial measure the state of California passed last year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>AB5 forced gig economy companies (like Uber and Lyft) to classify their drivers as "employees" instead of what they currently call them: "independent contractors."</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">More than semantics are at stake</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>contractor → employee shift carries a lot of <a href="https://mashable.com/article/uber-lyft-california-prop-22-gig-workers/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">legal luggage</a>, like health benefits and minimum wage requirements. From the POV of Uber, Lyft, DoorDash, etc., that luggage is way too heavy.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>So<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>after refusing to comply with AB5 and threatening to shut down in CA, they started <a href="https://ballotpedia.org/California_Proposition_22,_App-Based_Drivers_as_Contractors_and_Labor_Policies_Initiative_(2020)?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">throwing their weight</a> behind Prop 22. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And by weight, we mean cash. Uber and Lyft poured $57 million and $49 million, respectively, into the Yes on Prop 22 campaign, pushing total funding to nearly $200 million. In other words, Californians are about to vote on the most expensive ballot measure of all time.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Will it pass? </strong>Your guess is as good as ours: A new poll found that 46% of voters <a href="https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-10-26/berkeley-poll-california-prop-22-15-races-tighten-november-2020-election?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plan to vote</a> in favor and 42% against. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Dive deeper: </strong>We rounded up some articles that argue both sides. Read them <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/23/start-talking-uber-lyft-ab5-gig-economy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/26/nasa-study-discovers-definitive-presence-water-moon?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
NASA Finds Flat Seltzer on the Moon
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NASA had teased a big announcement about the moon for weeks, and yesterday it finally spilled the beans: There is <a href="https://www.space.com/water-on-moon-shadow-cold-traps-discovery?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">water on the moon</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To clarify,<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>scientists have been hypothesizing about the presence of H<sub style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;">2</sub>O on the moon since 1971. But yesterday's announcement officially confirmed that 1) there is more of it than we thought and 2) it can exist outside the freezing craters in the moon's permanently shadowy polar regions. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It's a big deal because...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NASA's <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/19/nasa-taps-nokia-install-4g-network-moon?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Project Artemis</a> is aiming to have a sustained human presence on the moon by 2028, and more accessible water can help achieve that goal. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">It's not just for drinking:</strong></span><span> The water could be </span><span><a href="https://www.cnet.com/features/nasa-telescope-uncovers-definitive-evidence-of-water-on-the-moon/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">used</a></span><span> to help with various life support functions, conduct new experiments with plant life, and even create rocket fuel.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> The Outer Space Treaty of 1967 prevents any nation from planting a flag on the moon and calling dibs. But as new discoveries and technological advances make the moon more hospitable to human life, new rules will have to be drafted to ensure every space-faring nation, as well as the burgeoning private space industry, gets a piece of the moon's cheese. </p>

Ginsburg. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eSAP\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThink you had an unproductive Monday? At least you didn't lose $35 billion (we hope). That's how much SAP's \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/26/sap-market-cap-plunges-by-30-billion.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emarket value fell\u003c/a\u003e yesterday, following dismal Q3 earnings that tanked shares 23%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSAP who? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEurope's biggest tech company by sales, SAP is a German software vendor that rose to prominence in the '70s and '80s selling enterprise resource planning software (which organizes business processes like HR, customer relationship management, and accounting into a shared database). \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAgainst the backdrop of \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/25/third-wave-covid19-threatens-us-businesses?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erising Covid-19 infections\u003c/a\u003e, SAP cutting profit targets and hunkering down for a couple more quarters could be a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-26/sap-s-disappointing-results-are-warning-for-u-s-tech-earnings?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworrying sign\u003c/a\u003e for other tech companies. Shares of SAP's competitors Salesforce and Oracle fell 3.4% and 4%, respectively.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSAP was already dealing with some clouds\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the last decade, SAP has moved to join its legacy tech peers IBM and Microsoft aboard the cloud computing bandwagon. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBack in the old days when you looked up your crush's number in the white pages, companies stored their data on computer servers in the office basement. With the rise of cloud computing, they can now buy that software over the internet and outsource the hardware to cloud infrastructure providers like Amazon, Google, and Microsoft. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe cloud is \u003ca href=\"https://www.zdnet.com/article/sap-charts-new-course-to-accelerate-cloud-shift-co-innovation-one-data-model/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecannibalizing\u003c/a\u003e the software licensing model SAP used to make its big bucks from. So SAP is pushing customers to cloud-based software subscriptions, which bring in less money upfront but offer a more predictable, recurring revenue stream. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat transition takes time, even without a pandemic. While Covid-19 has accelerated cloud adoption, it's also created more uncertainty for businesses—forcing some to \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/10/26/sap-shares-fall-sharply-after-covid-19-cuts-revenue-profit-forecast-at-software-giant/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehit pause\u003c/a\u003e on big IT investments. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe latest wave of Covid infections means SAP is expecting to feel those impacts through the first half of 2021.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eTech stocks have buoyed the market recovery, but SAP's plunge could undermine investor confidence in other software vendors facing similar style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWe’ve Come a Long Way Since Farmville\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFacebook announced yesterday it’s rolling out a \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/26/21528438/facebook-cloud-gaming-beta-android-web-jason-rubin-interview?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecloud gaming service\u003c/a\u003e, in case you wanted to do something on the platform other than check whether it's any of your friends' birthdays. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s not the first to have the idea\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoogle, Amazon, and Microsoft have all rolled out \u003ca href=\"https://www.engadget.com/facebook-cloud-gaming-launch-web-android-asphalt-9-legends-120007686.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etheir own\u003c/a\u003e cloud gaming platforms with eye-popping tech specs and exclusive titles to attract paying customers. But Facebook is taking a fundamentally different approach than its rivals, focusing on free games, like the \u003cem\u003eFarmville\u003c/em\u003e of yesteryear, that you can play within the Facebook app at your leisure.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThis is supposed to be a casual and accessible gaming experience: “No special hardware or controllers needed; your hands are the controller,” Jason Rubin, Facebook’s VP of Play, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/fbgaminghome/blog/cloud-gaming-meet-facebook-gaming?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in a blog post. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut one rotten Apple is cramping Rubin’s style. For now, FB’s games will only be available on Android and the web (not on iOS) because Facebook’s offering doesn’t jibe with Apple’s guidelines around streamable content.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e While rolling out a completely free-to-use service might not make business sense on the surface, Facebook makes money by keeping users on Facebook. Easy-to-pick-up, instantly available games streamed from the cloud might do just that. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAB5 forced gig economy companies (like Uber and Lyft) to classify their drivers as \"employees\" instead of what they currently call them: \"independent contractors.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMore than semantics are at stake\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003econtractor → employee shift carries a lot of \u003ca href=\"https://mashable.com/article/uber-lyft-california-prop-22-gig-workers/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elegal luggage\u003c/a\u003e, like health benefits and minimum wage requirements. From the POV of Uber, Lyft, DoorDash, etc., that luggage is way too heavy.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eSo\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eafter refusing to comply with AB5 and threatening to shut down in CA, they started \u003ca href=\"https://ballotpedia.org/California_Proposition_22,_App-Based_Drivers_as_Contractors_and_Labor_Policies_Initiative_(2020)?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethrowing their weight\u003c/a\u003e behind Prop 22. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd by weight, we mean cash. Uber and Lyft poured $57 million and $49 million, respectively, into the Yes on Prop 22 campaign, pushing total funding to nearly $200 million. In other words, Californians are about to vote on the most expensive ballot measure of all time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWill it pass? \u003c/strong\u003eYour guess is as good as ours: A new poll found that 46% of voters \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-10-26/berkeley-poll-california-prop-22-15-races-tighten-november-2020-election?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplan to vote\u003c/a\u003e in favor and 42% against. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Dive deeper: \u003c/strong\u003eWe rounded up some articles that argue both sides. style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003escientists have been hypothesizing about the presence of H\u003csub style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e2\u003c/sub\u003eO on the moon since 1971. regions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt's a big deal because...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNASA's \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/19/nasa-taps-nokia-install-4g-network-moon?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eProject Artemis\u003c/a\u003e is aiming to have a sustained human presence on the moon by 2028, and more accessible water href=\"https://www.cnet.com/features/nasa-telescope-uncovers-definitive-evidence-of-water-on-the-moon/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eused\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to help with various life support functions, conduct new experiments with plant life, and even create rocket fuel.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong
